00001 //-*- mode:C++ ; c-basic-offset: 2 -*-
00002 #include "DF_LatLon_Point.hpp"
00003 #include "Util_Misc.hpp"

00005 #include <vector>

00007 using namespace std;

00009 namespace DFLib

00011   namespace LatLon

00014     // class Point
00015     Point::Point()
00016       : llDirty(true),
00017         mercDirty(false)
00018     {
00019       char *latlon_argv[2]={"proj=latlong",
00020                             "datum=WGS84"};
00021       char *mercator_argv[3]={"proj=merc",
00022                               "ellps=WGS84",
00023                               "lat_ts=0"};
00024       if (!(latlonProj = pj_init(2,latlon_argv)))
00025       {
00026         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize lat/lon projection"));
00027       }
00028 
00029       if (!(mercProj = pj_init(3,mercator_argv)))
00030       {
00031         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize mercator projection"));
00032       }
00033 
00034       theLatLon.resize(2,0.0);
00035       theMerc.resize(2,0.0);
00036     }
00037 
00038     Point::Point(const vector<double> &aPosition)
00039       : theLatLon(aPosition),
00040         llDirty(true),
00041         mercDirty(false)
00042 
00043     {
00044       // Create the proj.4 stuff.  This is highly inefficient, as it should
00045       // live in the base class, not each object.  Fix that.
00046 
00047       char *latlon_argv[2]={"proj=latlong",
00048                             "datum=WGS84"};
00049       char *mercator_argv[3]={"proj=merc",
00050                               "ellps=WGS84",
00051                               "lat_ts=0"};
00052       if (!(latlonProj = pj_init(2,latlon_argv)))
00053       {
00054         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize lat/lon projection"));
00055       }
00056 
00057       if (!(mercProj = pj_init(3,mercator_argv)))
00058       {
00059         throw(Util::Exception("Failed to initialize mercator projection"));
00060       }
00061 
00062       // Don't bother trying to force the mercator --- we'll do that if
00063       // we query, because we're setting llDirty to true, just initialize
00064       // to junk.
00065       theMerc.resize(2,0.0);
00066     }
00067 
00068     Point::Point(const Point &right)
00069       : latlonProj(right.latlonProj),
00070         mercProj(right.mercProj)
00071     {
00072       if (right.mercDirty)
00073       {
00074         // Right's mercator's been changed without its LL being 
00075         // updated, so copy its mercator values and say we're dirty.
00076         theMerc=right.theMerc;
00077         mercDirty=true;
00078       } 
00079       else
00080       {
00081         // Just copy its LL and mark dirty.
00082         theLatLon=right.theLatLon;
00083         llDirty=true;
00084       }
00085     }
00086 
00087     void Point::setXY(const vector<double> &aPosition)
00088     {
00089       theMerc = aPosition;
00090       // Essential to set llDirty=false, otherwise getXY will try to 
00091       // convert ll and we'll be wrong.
00092       mercDirty=true;  
00093       llDirty=false;
00094     }
00095 
00096     const vector<double> & Point::getXY()
00097     {
00098       if (llDirty)
00099       {
00100         // our LL has been changed, so update
00101         llToMerc();
00102       }
00103       return(theMerc);
00104     }
00105 
00106     void Point::setLL(const vector<double> &llPosition)
00107     {
00108       theLatLon = llPosition;
00109       // If we set ll, must now trump mercator.
00110       llDirty=true; mercDirty=false;
00111     }
00112 
00113     const vector<double> & Point::getLL()
00114     {
00115       if (mercDirty)
00116       {
00117         // our LL has been changed, so update
00118         mercToLL();
00119       }
00120       return(theLatLon);
00121     }
00122     
00123     Point * Point::Clone()
00124     {
00125       Point *retPoint;
00126       retPoint = new Point(*this);
00127       return retPoint;
00128     }
00129 
00130     void Point::llToMerc()
00131     {
00132       projUV data;
00133       double z;
00134       data.u = theLatLon[0]*DEG_TO_RAD;
00135       data.v = theLatLon[1]*DEG_TO_RAD;
00136       z=0;
00137       if (pj_transform(latlonProj,mercProj,1,0,&(data.u),&(data.v),&z) != 0)
00138       {
00139         throw(Util::Exception("Failure converting LL to Mercator"));
00140       }
00141       theMerc.resize(2);
00142       theMerc[0]=data.u;
00143       theMerc[1]=data.v;
00144 
00145       llDirty=false;
00146     }      
00147 
00148 
00149     void Point::mercToLL()
00150     {
00151       projUV data;
00152       double z;
00153       data.u = theMerc[0];
00154       data.v = theMerc[1];
00155       z=0;
00156       if (pj_transform(mercProj,latlonProj,1,0,&(data.u),&(data.v),&z) != 0)
00157       {
00158         throw(Util::Exception("Failure converting Mercator to LL"));
00159       }
00160       theLatLon.resize(2);
00161       theLatLon[0]=data.u*RAD_TO_DEG;
00162       theLatLon[1]=data.v*RAD_TO_DEG;
00163 
00164       mercDirty=false;
00165     }      
00166   }
00167 }
